it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.message

Class CoapMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.message.CoapMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoapRequest, CoapResponse

    public class CoapMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    CoapMessage is a CoAP message as defined in the IETF RFC 7252 "Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP)".

    CoAP messages are encoded in a simple binary format. The message format starts with a fixed-size 4-byte header. This is followed by a variable-length Token value which can be between 0 and 8 bytes long. Following the Token value comes a sequence of zero or more CoAP Options in Type-Length-Value (TLV) format, optionally followed by a payload which takes up the rest of the datagram.

      • type

        protected CoapMessageType type
        Type (T): 2-bit unsigned integer. Indicates if this message is of type Confirmable (0), Non-Confirmable (1), Acknowledgement (2) or Reset (3)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoapMessage

        public CoapMessage(CoapMessage msg)
        Creates a new CoapMessage.
        Parameters:

      • CoapMessage

        public CoapMessage(CoapMessageType type,
                   int code)
        Creates a new CoapMessage.
        Parameters:
        type - message type (Confirmable (0), Non-Confirmable (1), Acknowledgement (2) or Reset (3))
        code - request method (1-31) or response code (64-191), or 0 for empty message

      • CoapMessage

        public CoapMessage(CoapMessageType type,
                   int code,
                   int message_id)
        Creates a new CoapMessage.
        Parameters:
        type - message type (Confirmable (0), Non-Confirmable (1), Acknowledgement (2) or Reset (3))
        code - request method (1-31) or response code (64-191), or 0 for empty message
        message_id - message ID, used for the detection of message duplication, and to match messages of type Acknowledgement/Reset to messages of type Confirmable/Non-confirmable

                   int off,

        Creates a new CoapMessage.
        Parameters:
        buf - buffer containing the CoAP message
        off - message offset within the buffer
        len - message length

      • setCode

        public CoapMessage setCode(int code)
        Sets message code.
        Parameters:
        code - the message code, indicating the request method (1-31) for requests, the response code (64-191) for responses, or is empty (0)
        Returns:
        this message

      • getCode

        public int getCode()
        Gets message code. Code indicates if the message carries a request (1-31) or a response (64-191), or is empty (0) (All other code values are reserved). In case of a request, the Code field indicates the Request Method; in case of a response a Response Code.
        Returns:
        the message code

      • getCodeAsString

        public java.lang.String getCodeAsString()
        Gets message code as string.
        Returns:
        "empty" for empty message, "GET" for GET request, "POST" for POST request, "PUT" for PUT request, "DELETE" for DELETE request, or response code descrition for responses

      • getCodeAsString

        public static java.lang.String getCodeAsString(int code)
        Gets a string representation of a message code.
        Parameters:
        code - the message code
        Returns:
        "empty" for empty message, "GET" for GET request, "POST" for POST request, "PUT" for PUT request, "DELETE" for DELETE request, or response code descrition for responses

      • getToken

        public byte[] getToken()
        Gets message token ("request ID"). The Token value is used to correlate requests and responses. It may be 0 (null) to 8 bytes.
        Returns:
        the token (or null in case no token is present)

      • getTokenAsString

        public java.lang.String getTokenAsString()
        Gets message token ("request ID") as hexadecimal string. The Token value is used to correlate requests and responses. It may be 0 (null) to 8 bytes.
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal representation of the token (or null in case no token is present)

        Parameters:
        token - the message token
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal representation of the token (or null in case no token is present)
